task_summary: Remove the lid from the pot, place the pot onto the plate, then use the spatula tool to push the pot toward the front edge of the table.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop robot manipulator operates over a board with circular stove markers, a plate, a pot with a lid, a bowl, and a spatula-like tool. The robot must first disengage the lid from the pot, then grasp the pot securely and place it onto the nearby plate. After placing and releasing the pot, the robot re-grasps the spatula tool and performs a controlled push to slide the pot toward the front edge of the table, keeping motions planar and avoiding collisions with the bowl or board fixtures.
preconditions: Pot, plate, and spatula are visible within reachable workspace
Lid is initially on the pot
Table surface is clear enough to slide the pot
stepwise_plan: Perceive pot, plate, and spatula; confirm the scene
Grasp the pot, lift slightly, and place onto the plate
Push the pot toward the table front
success_criteria: Lid is no longer covering the pot
Pot rests stably centered on the plate
Pot is pushed forward by the specified distance without tipping
failure_and_recovery: If grasp is unstable, retry alignment and re-grasp
If placement misses the plate, lift and re-place using tighter tolerance
If push stalls due to friction, re-approach with tool and increase push distance incrementally
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after the pot is on the plate and has been pushed to the front by the commanded distance with no active contacts.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Take the lid off the pot, put the pot on the plate, and use the tool to push to pot to the front of the table.

node_specs.description: Perceive the pot pose and visibility.
Perceive the plate pose for later placement.
Perceive the tool pose for pushing.
Remove or open the lid on the pot.
Prepare gripper for grasping the pot.
Align end-effector with the pot for grasp.
Close on the pot with moderate force.
Lift the pot slightly to clear obstacles.
Place the pot onto the plate area.
Release the pot on the plate.
Approach and align to grasp the spatula tool.
Grasp the spatula with gentle force.
Push the pot toward the front (south) using the spatula.

recovery_strategy: Retry OpenContainer with slightly different approach
Re-align and re-grasp with adjusted force
Re-lift and re-place with smaller tolerance
Re-approach tool and increase grasp force
Shorten push distance and push in multiple passes
assumptions: Front of the table corresponds to direction_deg=180 in table frame
Lid is present at start though some frames appear to show contents already visible
Pushing is performed while pot rests on the plate to reduce frictional tipping

expected_success_criteria: Pot translated forward by ~0.20 m using tool without tipping
